result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation conditions apply, except for the condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all mandatory court costs, fees and assessments, to be paid while on probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendant to make monthly payments.
Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Seek and maintain full time employment. Court notes that working in his own business will count.

No alcohol, no drug paraphernalia, and no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
AODA assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
UP FRONT.
Consecutive to: Huber for work.
Complete 50 hours of community service at a non-profit organization. 25 hours to be completed at Northcott Neighborhood House.

IMPOSED and STAYED.
Consecutive to: To be used by the agent for any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayton Laranze Jefferson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS, with credit for 1 DAY time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, AND IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 30 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Serve 30 DAYS UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction - with huber for work.
                      
REPORT IN DATE:  DECEMBER 26, 2014 AT 10:00 AM.

- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations. 
- AODA assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.
- No alcohol, no drug paraphernalia, and no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.
- Complete 50 hours of community service at a non profit organization.  25 hours to be completed at Northcott Neighborhood house.
- Seek and maintain full time employment.  Court notes that working in his own business will count.
- No firearms and weapons.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, to be paid while on probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Sentencing referral form; 
Written Explanationof Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on  12/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders PSI.  PSI order signed and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 10/3/2014 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Patterson has just been appointed on this case.  State will provide defense with a copy of discovery this week.  Court vacates all previous dates.  Case adjourned for for scheduling conference on 8/19/2014 at 8:30 and for jury trial on 12/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Defense counsel informed the court if they are challenging the statement.    aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case resumed.  Defendant qualifies for public representation.  Court informs defendant that he can still try to hire private counsel, and have them at the next court appearance.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 7/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Karl Hayes.
Defendant has not been able to retain a attorney.  He is trying to retain Mr. Levine.  Court orders defendant to go to the public defender's office to see if he qualifies for an attorney.  Case passed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for a plea hearing.  Court started taking defendant's plea.  Case passed for defendant to speak with his attorney.  Case resumed.  Attorney Ploetz states there is no basis to accept defendant's plea, and that there has been a breakdown in communication.  Attorney Ploetz requests to withdraw.  Court grants attorney Ploetz motion to withdraw.  Defendant to obtain a new lawyer.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 7/9/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw
Defendant would like to resolve the case.  Attorney requests a earlier date.  Case adjourned for plea hearing on 6-24-2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Court finds there is no factual basis to accept defendant's plea.  Case set for trial, and miranda hearing.  Case adjourned for motion hearing and final pretrial on 8/12/2014 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 9/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court will modify bail, if court receives another positive test.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/9/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  If court receives another positive test, court will modify bail.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's atorney, Peter Ploetz, is unavailable for today's proceedings.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Logan Jarecki.  Case in court due to violation.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Scheduling Conference on May 27, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 3.

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is still needs discovery.  State turned over two CD today.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Adam Galaviz, as a friend of the court, for attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Karl Hayes.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Court addresses violation report.  Defendant tested positive for THC.  Defendant warned.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court informs defendant that bail will be modified if he continues to test positive.  Case remains scheduled for plea hearing on 4/28/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Stephan Sargent for attorney Reyna Morales and attorney Peter D. Ploetz.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has retained attorney Ploetz.  Attorney Morales unable to appear today.  Court allows attorney Morales to withdraw.  Attorney Sargent will inform attorney Morales of today's proceedings, and to turn over all discovery to attorney Ploetz.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/28/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Adam Galaviz for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:John Schott-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/24/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Clayton Laranze Jefferson in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL, however defendant indicates he may wish to retain private counsel for future proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
